description: From Latin gluma (“husk of grain”). The root can also be seen in glubere (“to peel”).

entries.meaning: (botany) A basal, membranous, outer sterile husk or bract in the flowers of grasses (Poaceae) and sedges (Cyperaceae).
examples: [T]he glume in some alpine grasses, and the scales of the ament in the salix rosea, rose-willow, grow into leaves; and produce other kinds of monsters.
